intro: Pachyptera kerere var. erythraea, commonly known as the Red-eyed African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 cm. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its striking foliage and vibrant floral displays.
